myMath

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    cont_function, function, Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Igor & Amit

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Polynom()
      Initiate empty polynom
      Polynom(java.lang.String _p)
      Initializer with string example for input : "-3x^3 - 3x^4 + 5x^2 - 1x^1" split the string with 'space' and store it on 'splited_p' checking each string: if operator => merge the operator with next string split strings with "x^", add with the new information (from last split) new monom to p with parse(Double/Int).

      Adding monom to a polynom according to its _power index.

      Computes area above y=0

      Compare p with p1 using 'deep monom compare' method.
      double f(double x) 
      java.lang.String HandlePolynomSpaces(java.lang.String str)
      this method checks if a certain polynom has spaces, if it does -> delete them, and prepares the string for split by monoms (according to '-' / '+' signs).
      boolean isZero()
      Checks if the given polynom is the zero polynom.

      • Polynom

        public Polynom()
        Initiate empty polynom

      • Polynom

        public Polynom(java.lang.String _p)
        Initializer with string example for input : "-3x^3 - 3x^4 + 5x^2 - 1x^1" split the string with 'space' and store it on 'splited_p' checking each string: if operator => merge the operator with next string split strings with "x^", add with the new information (from last split) new monom to p with parse(Double/Int).
        Parameters:
        _p - Gets a string from the user, which contains a data of a new polynom.

      • root

        public double root(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        Calculating root between x0 and x1 with eps is the correction limit. ASSUMING: f(x0)*f(x1)<=0
        Specified by:
        root in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - left bound of [x0, x1]
        x1 - right bound of [x0, x1]
        eps - a small number aspiring to 0
        Returns:
        x root of a polynom which has been found

      • area

        public double area(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        Computes area above y=0
        Specified by:
        area in interface cont_function
        Specified by:
        area in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0,x1 - = bounds for area calculation
        eps - = deltaX = length for each rectangle using 'Riemann's Sum' method.
        Returns:
        area = Sum: f(Xi)*deltaX

      • HandlePolynomSpaces

        public java.lang.String HandlePolynomSpaces(java.lang.String str)
        this method checks if a certain polynom has spaces, if it does -> delete them, and prepares the string for split by monoms (according to '-' / '+' signs).
        Parameters:
        str - the string in which we need to check for spaces into.
        Returns:
        str returns the string with spaces if needed.
